description.narrative: 'By 2020, education staff are capacitated and accountable for delivering curriculum reform and a continuous assessment system in primary schools, which contributes to Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, equitable access created and quality education and training provided to all learners at pre-primary and primary level and girls' access to secondary education increased, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children, populations and localities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 'By 2020, education staff are capacitated and accountable for delivering curriculum reform and a continuous assessment system in primary schools

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the establishment of a classroom-based assessment system in Ethiopia through the Assessment for Learning (AfL) Programme. The AfL was integrated into the in-service and pre-service Colleges of Education Curricula and its impact evaluation shows improvements in learning outcomes in Mathematics at primary school level. UNICEF supported the Ministry of Education and partners to conduct a comprehensive General Education Curriculum review process which laid the foundation for a new curriculum focusing on skills development for over 26 million children enrolled in pre-primary, primary and secondary schools. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: # of education staff trained for increased accountability and support for learning

actual.value: 2020:Score 3 GEQIP-E programme instituted a continuous classroom assessment intervention aimed at establishing a system-wide institutional capacity to ensure classroom assessment system in place The MoE integrated AfL into the Continuous Professional Development programme for all teachers. It was scaled

title.narrative: Share of the national budget on education (disaggregated by pre-primary / primary / secondary)

actual.value: 2020:Data not available The Education Section has prepared a Budget brief which makes an analysis of expenditure and highlights that most of the national budget is currently allocated to higher education. The budget brief recommends the need for budget breakdown by sub sector, including pre-primary. UNI

title.narrative: Primary Education Curriculum Revision Road-Map developed and initiated
Availability of a well functioning student learning assessment system for the early grades
Education systems are implementing a minimum package of interventions to promote learning outcomes including early learning
